div.l: Than that it rotte / al the remenaunt
So fareth it by a riotous seruaunt
It is ful lasse harm / to lete hym pace
Than he shende / alle the seruantz in the place
Euen as a stabbed schepe in þe folde
Alle a flocke wolle defyle both yonge ⁊ olde
Ryght euen so a febel seruaunt may
Distruye fourty of his felaws in a day
Therfore / his maister gaf hym acquitaunce
And bad hym go / with sorw / and with meschaunce
Better ys betyme to voyde suche a clerke
The lenger he abydeth þe wors is his werke
He þat his Maister no profite wolle wynne
Y holde hym better out of þe hous þan with ynne
And thus this ioly prentys / hadde his leeue
Now lat hym riote / al the nyght or leeue
And for ther nys no theef withoute a lowke
That helpeth hym / to wasten and to sowke
Of that he brybe kan / or borwe may
Anon / he sente his bed / and his array
Vnto a compeer / of his owene sort
That loued dees / and reuel / and disport
And hadde a wyf / that heeld for contenaunce
A shoppe / and swyued for hir sustenaunce
What thorowe hym selfe and his felawe that sought
Vnto a myschefe bothe þey were broght
The tone y dampned to presoun perpetually
The tother to deth for he couthe not of clergye
And therfore yonge men lerne while ye may
That with mony dyuers thoghtes beth prycked al þe day
Remembre you what myschefe cometh of mysgouernaunce
Thus mowe ye lerne worschep and come to substaunce
Thenke how grace and governaunce hath broght hem a boune
Many pore mannys sonne chese state of þe towne
Euer rewle the after þe beste man of name
And god may grace þe to come to þe same
¶ Here endith the Cokys tale
// Incipit Fabula /
And thus with hordam and briberie
Togeder thei vsed tyl hanged hye
For who so euel byeth shal make a sory sale
And thus I make an ende of my tale
But herof I wolle passe as now
And of ȝong Gamelyn I wil telle ȝow
Fye þer one it is so foule I wil nowe tell no forþere
For schame of the harlotrie þat seweþ after
A velany it were þare of more to spell
Bot of a knyhte and his sounes My tale I wil forþe tell
Here be gynnytht the Cokys tale ⁊c
¶ Incipit Fabula de Gemelyn
NOw lithe and lystenyth so god geue you goode fyne
And ye schulle here gode game of yonge Gamelyn
